summary:
A seasoned Software Engineer with almost 7 years of industry experience. I've had the privilege of working in both back-end and front-end positions, honing my skills in crafting robust solutions. During my journey, I've contributed to diverse projects in the defense industry in Turkey, and spent the last 2 years in the Netherlands, where I furthered my expertise at VodafoneZiggo as a backend engineer.

Now, I'm thrilled to dive into frontend development, crafting captivating user experiences. Proficient in React, Redux, Axios, Next.js, and more. Although I have more experience as a backend engineer than a frontend engineer, I'm eager to leverage my fast-learning capabilities and adaptability to create intuitive and visually captivating frontend solutions.

I've designed this portfolio website to showcase my diverse skill set. Explore my curated collection of React components, showcasing frontend logic expertise. Each page provides detailed insights into encountered challenges and the implemented solutions. I have recreated these components as accurately as possible, employing fictional scenarios.

Feel free to reach out for any inquiries or collaborations!

experienceEvents.summary:
During my time at VodafoneZiggo, I actively contributed to the development of a NaaS solution as a back-end engineer, leveraging Java 8, Maven, and Amdocs' NEO platform. I independently learned and utilized the Robot Framework for API testing, ensuring the solution's reliability and seamless integration with various environments.

Working in an agile environment, I collaborated closely with teams, embracing effective communication and problem-solving to deliver successful outcomes. Using the technologies like AWS, Kubernetes, Drool rules, and Postman, I gained valuable experience in cloud infrastructure and rule-based logic. Collaborating effectively with teams, I delivered reliable results and developed a passion for frontend development.

At HAVELSAN, a defense industry company, I had the privilege of contributing to diverse projects, showcasing my versatility and expertise as a fullstack engineer.

In the Big Data and AI Department, I played a key role in developing microservices for a business intelligence software utilized by the Ministry of Education. I was responsible for the development of two microservices, Workspace, and Schedule services, delivering crucial capabilities. Using technologies like MongoDB for data storage, RabbitMQ for event handling, and Swagger for code documentation, we ensured the reliability and scalability of the solution.

Additionally, I excelled as a frontend developer for the submarine sensor tracking and validating project for The Turkish NAVY, contributing my skills and dedication for the last 2 years. This project allowed me to enhance my proficiency in frontend technologies, including React, Redux, Axios, D3, and more, and offered valuable insights into creating intuitive and visually appealing user interfaces.

In the R&D Department, I contributed to the development of RESTful endpoints for the Technology Management System, an internal tool used for command control solutions in the military field. We followed a monolith structure, employing the Spring Framework, Maven, Hibernate, MySQL, and Tomcat for back-end development. On the front-end, we utilized an in-house JavaScript (ES6) framework.

During my graduation internship at HAVELSAN, I made valuable contributions to the development of a military joint capability area management software. As part of the project's inception, I played a vital role in crafting essential endpoints using Java, Spring Boot, and JPA, contributing to the software's foundation.

Moreover, I honed my skills in front-end development, creating prototype screens for the software using AngularJS and Bootstrap. This hands-on experience allowed me to explore the world of modern web development and gain expertise in these technologies.

During my first internship at TÜBİTAK, I took on the responsibility of developing a software solution for storing and managing third-party software licenses purchased by the company. Given the freedom to choose any programming language, I opted for Delphi, aiming to further enhance my proficiency in this language even tough it's a fairly old language and not popular anymore.

The result of my efforts was a successful desktop application that efficiently stored and allowed users to check the acquired software licenses. This application became an integral part of the team's workflow and was utilized to manage licenses effectively.
